msbt.message: Don't you think that folks should pick one thing and, like, obsess over it completely?
Right? I mean, I wouldn't be so good at if I hadn't practiced relentlessly. The key is to keep trying over and over again, even if you're driving everyone else around you nuts.
I mean, I guess there's a slight downside if you let everything else in your life fade away But the upside is that I'm incredible at now, so Worth it!
Did I ever tell you about the band I used to be in?

Well, it's a really long but incredibly interesting storyBut I'll just give you the highlights. Massive success, world tour, fans chanting our names The usual! And we topped it all off with a huge public breakup just like a legendary rock band should.

Ah, it's such a good storybut I am legally prohibited from sharing all of the details at this time. Let's just say that a number of city ordinances were violated by certain band members. Yep, that was a good show
Alright, alright. I'll spare you the details. Just know that we're still available for house parties.
Yeah, yeah. Long story short, we had a difference of musical opinion. Learn the difference between A-minor and A-minor seventh, Nigel! !
You know what one of my pet peeves is? When folks call plants that they don't like "weeds."

These plants have names, man! And they're some of the toughest in the plant kingdom! Think about it. Folks are actively trying to eradicate them, and they just keep on thriving everywhere! I wish I was as tough as some of these weeds

We should show some respect and at least learn their names!Like goosegrass. It'll grow anywhere! I think there's some growing inside my refrigerator! , if folks could be more like goosegrass, the world would be a better place.
Like "Queen of the Night!"I mean, sure, it's poisonous, it smells bad, and it will absolutely devastate your garden But that name! I wish I had a tenth of its swagger.
On days like today, I can't help but think back to my childhood

We used to have these huge dance parties in my neighborhood. Everyone would show up! The thing isI didn't know how to dance. So I used to play the piano while everyone else got down. Now I'm a world-class dancer, but I can't string two notes together on the piano. Guess the universe had to keep me humble somehow

Back when I waslet's say, on the shy sideI didn't know how to talk to anyone! One time I saw someone give a girl some flowers in a movie, so I started doing that with everyone. Pretty soon, folks came to expect flowers from me almost every day, and I was going broke! Long story short, the flower shop gave me a gold-plated in celebration of my service.

I used to put ketchup on everything. I mean EVERYTHING.Like . Ketchup! ? Ketchup. And ? Yup! Ketchup. Then one day, I spilled the bottle of ketchup that I carried around in my backpack. IN my backpack. That day was the ketchupocalypse for poor old
Back when I was in "the business," as they say, it was always so hard to find good "talent," as they say

It's like, you never knew whether the other extras on the set could hack it. Sometimes they'd just sit there and sip lattes in the background, totally blending in. I had to show them how it was done! You've gotta draw attention to yourself if you want to be featured! Spill the latte on yourself and cause a scene! Boom, acting!<10_4 /> They said they'd never done more takes, ever.
We had a guy who was in charge of writing the cue cards, but his handwriting was too messy! The actors couldn't read the lines, so they made up their own. <10_4 />We won every award that season!
It's like when I was a news anchor for a brief period of time.There was only one person at the station who could style my hair just the right way. And it was ME! !
When I look back at the choices I've made throughout my life, I have to admitthey were always right.

For example, when I was just a little guy, I couldn't stand the smell of . I refused to eat it. One day, my mom asked me how I would ever enjoy the finer things in life if I never even gave them a try. And from that day forward, I made the choice to always enjoy the finer things in life. Even if I hated them!

During my formative years, my parents took me to a live show. The showmanship and dedication I saw in those musicians was beyond inspiring. Staring out at the waves of adoring fans, I decided, right then and there, I would be just like those musicians. Universally beloved!
This morning I chose to pull off the shelf. And you know what? I can't imagine a better read for a day like today.

When I was an itty-bitty , I had this friend who got me hooked on . And some days, I look back and wonder if that was one of those life-defining moments The point is, even my choice of friends has always been spot on.

Ever since I was a young , my gran-gran has gotten me anything I wanted for my birthday. Talk about a high-stakes decision!One year, I made six pro-and-con lists and spent months researching the trendiest toys on the market. But when I finally unwrapped that brand-new , I knew I would cherish it for all time. Huh. Whatever happened to that ol'
The point is, those decisions made me who I am today.And let's be honest, the results speak for themselves, .
